content.text:
# Photos from the Hoyt Arboretum

A few weeks ago [@kathleen](@GSuGLzJa8t3aJCLvs66Ekn7MXdr3yqCSzsd6z2iUEBY=.ed25519) and I went to the [Hoyt Arboretum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Arboretum) and had a great time wandering around in the forest together. I'm really bad at doing Portland things but I had a lot of fun.

![Photo of a mossy tree branch in a foggy forest](&TD3MMMC9mWk/XuXRBbmpKTzp3i26RWJ3jCwvLEs5Slo=.sha256)

![Photo of a foggy trail with tall pine trees](&CbTtXB+5oa+7q3i1WoA9vfP201OkvIe5w7JcvaQDo28=.sha256)

![Photo of Kathleen walking in the same trail as above](&ibH0Y1TbaB7jiPfhapoPTBZ6ujy61Stw9Uxiv7BKe7g=.sha256)

![Photo of a stump with an clump of orange mushrooms](&Aqz28j1kEHp1UHQADs2ohRYhpoo6KBeu7NOwCxWZKFE=.sha256)

![Up-close photo of the above stump with a detail shot of the mushrooms](&yceh8PxLSc4pksYUJyvYpwChfVaDlnpIKFJHolXXoRE=.sha256)

![Photo of sprawling tree roots exposed, maybe because of erosion](&gchTMMzL+guWGZirx1j+tNyO7+8pa2vaNWdtREEn6ow=.sha256)
 
#photography #myco #forests #portland #pnw #trees
